data.title: How to Download and Install Blue Fish Editor on Windows?
data.meta_description: A Computer Science portal for geeks. It contains well written, well thought and well explained computer science and programming articles, quizzes and practice/competitive programming/company interview Questions.
data.text:
While it’s not quite as user-friendly as its commercial competitors or the other open-source options listed here, Bluefish offers a very fast WYSIWYG HTML editor that doesn’t use a lot of system resources. Aimed at coders more than designers, it also includes support for a number of other programming languages. Bluefish is a free software advanced text editor with a variety of tools for programming and website development. It supports coding languages including HTML, XHTML, CSS, XML, PHP, C, C++, JavaScript, Java, Go, Vala, Ada, D, SQL, Perl, ColdFusion, JSP, Python, Ruby, and shell. It is easy to use.

Installing Blue Fish on Windows

Follow the below steps to install Blue Fish on Windows:

Step 1: Visit the official https://bluefish.openoffice.nl/index.html website using any web browser.

Step 2: Click on Download Button.

Step 3: Next screen will open Now Click on Win32 Installer Button.

Step 4: Next screen will open Now Click on BlueFish setup.exe to Download.

Step 5: Now check for the executable file in downloads in your system and run it.

Step 6: It will prompt confirmation to make changes to your system. Click on Yes

Step 7: The next screen is to choose your setup language which you want to choose and click on OK.

Step 8: The setup will start now click on Next.

Step 9: Next screen will be of license review now click on Next.

Step 10: Next screen is of choosing components, all components are already marked so don’t change anything just click on the Next button.

Step 11: The next screen will be of installing location so choose the drive which will have sufficient memory space for installation. It needed a memory space of roughly 35.6 MB. Click on the Next button.

Step 12: Next screen will be Choose Start Menu Folder Take any Name you want otherwise click on Next.

Step 13: Now downloading will start from the server it will take 10-15 minutes.

Step 14: Click on the Next button after the installation process is complete.

Step 15: Click on the Finish button after the installation process is complete.

Blue Fish is successfully installed on the system and an icon is created on the desktop.

Now Run the software and see the Interface.

Congratulations!! At this point, you have successfully installed Blue Fish on your windows 10 system.
